alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 6:07PM MST until August 20 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 605 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Skull Valley to Kirkland and eastward. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kirkland and Skull Valley. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 285 and 292. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Hassayampa River, Skull Valley Wash, Logan Wash, Copper Basin Wash, Finch Wash, Iron Springs Wash, and Kirkland Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
